SEARCH
Package project.star_wars_universe.data.loading

Class PlanetsDataLoader

java.lang.Object
project.star_wars_universe.data.loading.PlanetsDataLoader
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataLoader<List<Planet>>
public class PlanetsDataLoader extends Object implements DataLoader<List<Planet>>
Loads and unloads Planet entities into the application. This class serves as an intermediate layer between the more general AppDataManager class and the PlanetsRepository in order to decrease coupling and encapsulate the logic for loading and unloading the Planet entities specifically.

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(List<Planet> planets) throws DataLoadingException
      Loads Planets into the application. It iterates through the provided List of Planets and adds them to the PlanetsRepository using its PlanetsRepository.add(Planet) method. If a Planet already exists in the repository, a PlanetAlreadyExistsException exception is thrown from the PlanetsRepository.add(Planet) method. This exception is then passed to a DataLoadingException instance, from which the specific exception can later be extracted using the DataLoadingException.getException() method.
      Specified by:
      load in interface DataLoader<List<Planet>>
      Parameters:
      planets - the List of Planets that should be loaded in the PlanetsRepository.
      Throws:
      DataLoadingException - if an exception occurs during the loading of the planets.

    • unload

      public void unload()
      Unloads the Planet entities from the application. It invokes the PlanetsRepository.removeAll() method which empties the repository.
      Specified by:
      unload in interface DataLoader<List<Planet>>
